awd_titl_txt: REU Site: REU Site on Smart UAVs
awd_abstract_narration:
This funding renews a Research Experiences for Undergraduates (REU) Site at Auburn University focused on smart unmanned aerial vehicles (smart UAVs).  Undergraduate students design algorithms and techniques to safely, securely, and efficiently fly a fleet of autonomous UAVs in a limited field. A nationwide recruitment process with particular emphasis on the southeast region of the United States is used to select cohorts of undergraduate students to participate in an eight-week summer research program at the host institution. The project includes mentoring by the experienced computer science faculty members, technical seminars and workshops, student presentations, field trips and other professional development opportunities. 
 
This project has a strong research basis and the support of a team with research experience as well as experience as pilots. The projects are in timely and appealing and accessible to a broad range of undergraduate students. The research projects are particularly focused on UAV autonomy, collision avoidance, secure communication, stable flight, and energy efficient flight.  The students participate in a full range of research activities from preparing research literature reviews to production and dissemination of research results. Emphasis is placed on recruitment of students from under-represented populations and institutions where students have limited research opportunities.  This project has the potential to produce new computer science graduate students and faculty members and to advance discovery and understanding while promoting learning.

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Computer and Information Science and Engineering
org_div_long_name: Division Of Computer and Network Systems

pgm_ref.pgm_ref_txt: REU SITE-Res Exp for Ugrd Site
EXP PROG TO STIM COMP RES

por.por_cntn:
The REU Site on Smart Unmanned Aerial Vehicles (UAVs) offered a research experience to 24 undergraduates in the field of unmanned flight during Summers 2020-2023. This REU site particularly targets undergraduate students who would not otherwise have any opportunity to learn about research or perform it. 30% of these participants come from under-represented minorites in computer sciece (women, African American, Hispanic, and Native Americans). For this last grant, this site admitted 5 additional participants using savings made in the previous years.

Each summer 8 to 9 outstanding undergraduates are selected among over 150 applicants to participate in this program. In just eight weeks, these participants worked and published quality technical reports about problems such as articificial intelligent based collision avoidance, GPS-less navigation, and computer vision based navigation. Some of these technical reports are submitted for publication at regional and national conferences.  

Over 72% of these participants eventually appply to graduate school. Some of them won best paper awards or scholarships like Goldwater or NSF Fellowships. One undergraduate who was working as a carpenter five years ago participated in this program after enrolling at a community college. Another participant was an undergraduate while working as a firefighter and taking care of  two children was recently accepted in the graduate program at Carbegie Mellon. He credits this REU site for helping him accomplish these achievements.

An independant evaluation of this REU site found that "Overall, students indicated high levels of self-efficacy, intent toward graduate school, attitudes toward research, coping, grit, research skills, teamwork/ leadership and identity as a scientist".

 


Last Modified: 03/03/2025
Modified by: Saad Biaz
